importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication, indicating when the public was informed about Doug Martin's death.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 to the end of his career by 2018.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He amassed 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns during his professional career.
He earned a Pro Bowl berth as a rookie in 2012 and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
The Buccaneers issued a public statement expressing deep sadness over his passing and acknowledging his lasting impact on the franchise.
The cause of death has not been confirmed, and the family requested privacy at this time.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout professional career with 5,356 rushing yards, 30 touchdowns, and 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. He earned a Pro Bowl berth as a rookie and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. The Buccaneers recognized his legacy, naming him one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The cause of death remains unconfirmed, and his family has requested privacy during this time.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
